FuncDef:
The filter-policy import command configures IS-IS to filter the received routes to be added to the IP routing table.
The undo filter-policy import command disables IS-IS from filtering received routes. The filter-policy import command configures IS-IS to filter the received routes to be added to the IP routing table. The undo filter-policy import command disables IS-IS from filtering received routes. By default, IS-IS does not filter received routes.
CLIs: undo filter-policy [ <acl-number> | acl-name <acl-name-string> | ip-prefix <ip-prefix-name> | route-policy <route-policy-name> ] import

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a basic ACL number.
The value is an integer ranging from 2000 to 2999.

Specifies the name of a named basic ACL.
The value is a string of 1 to 32 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Indicates the name of the IP prefix list.
The value is a string of 1 to 169 case-sensitive characters, with spaces not supported. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Specifies the name of a route-policy to filter routes based on tags and other protocol parameters.
The value is a string of 1 to 200 case-sensitive characters without spaces. The character string can contain spaces if it is enclosed with double quotation marks (").

ExtraInfo:
IS-IS routing entries need to be added to an IP routing table for IP packet forwarding.
If an IS-IS routing table has routes destined for a specific network segment, but you do not want to add these routes to an IP routing table, run the filter-policy import command with specified parameters to add only the needed IS-IS routes to the IP routing table.
